title: Unlock language learning with a Rosetta Stone membership for only $159.97
content:
Macworld

Thirty percent of Americans said they only learned a foreign language because it was required in school, according to a recent survey. Most let that learning slip once they became adults – and more than 70% now say they wish they hadn’t. Especially since 1 in 5 say they missed important career opportunities by not knowing a foreign language.

Right that wrong now with training in 25 different languages with a lifetime subscription to Rosetta Stone.

With instruction in languages like Spanish, French, Chinese, Arabic, Hindi, and Russian, Rosetta Stone’s award-winning interactive software focuses on immersive learning, replicating natural contextual learning by surrounding students in the new language from the start. 

This approach mirrors the way children learn their first language, fostering visual and auditory connections to enhance the learning process. Through conversation and word association, students develop their vocabulary and grammar in context, which leads to improved verbal and written comprehension. 

Academics aside, Rosetta Stone also makes language learning fun, incorporating stories and other stimulating lessons in the new language to make the learning entertaining and easy. The program also utilizes their TruACCENT speech-recognition engine to give learners personalized pronunciation assistance, along with live tutoring sessions with native speakers. 

Meanwhile, students can also access downloadable Audio Companion lessons for offline learning on various devices.

Right now, learners can get a lifetime subscription to the Rosetta Stone language learning system at one of the lowest prices of the year. Regularly nearly $400, it’s available now for only $159.97 using coupon code: ROSETTA if you make your purchase before 11:59 p.m. PT on New Year’s Day, Jan. 1.
